page.title: 14PEOPLE
page.content: All the occupants of the cottages are garden lovers & with the exception of one, where the owner is too old, take a delight in beautifying their patch. Most have dogs, often two to a house, & many cats sit around on gateposts. There is a car or van available at each house except two. Some, as owners or tenants, have lived in the same house for as long as 40 years. The only couples who have any doubts about staying for the rest of their lives, were those with young children, having no easy access to schools or the company of other children. Neither the hamlet of Heath End nor Calke has any facility at all other than the Saracen's Head public house, & a roadside pillar box. There is no public telephone in reach of either place.
